I Very old the world is growing And her weary children pray, Even be it ail unknowing, Miserere Domine ! Where the toilers in the city, Long for breeze and sunny ray, Angels hear it full of pity, Miserere Domine ! II Where the sick ones pine and languish, Scarcely knowing night from day, Riseth up in sighs of anguisli, Miserere Domine ! Through earths’ stony desert faring, Ever toil-worn pilgrims pray, Ali one mournfull anthem sharing, Miserere Domine ! III Still we wait the hour of gladness, When as shadows flee away, We shall sing no more in sadness Miserere Domine I IV Ah ! look Eastward, dawn is bringing, Promise of that golden day, Hope within, our heart is springing !
